benchmark_details.name: MANICOD (Manipulated Content Detection)
benchmark_details.overview: MANICOD is designed for detecting zero-day manipulated content using a dataset of 4,270 pieces of manipulated fake news derived from 2,500 recent real-world news headlines.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide an explainable detector for manipulated content that employs real-time contextual information for accurate classification.

data.source: Dataset created from crawling RSS feeds from reputable news sources over 20 days.
data.annotation: Manual alteration and review with bias considerations for ensuring the authenticity of manipulated content.

methodology.calculation: The F1 score was calculated as 0.856 based on precision and recall measures.
methodology.interpretation: Scores above 0.85 indicate strong performance in detecting manipulated content.
methodology.baseline_results: Comparison against existing benchmarks shows an up to 1.9x improvement in F1 score.
methodology.validation: MANICOD has been validated with a dataset specifically created for evaluating its performance.
